intro: Tetrastigma ceratopetalum, commonly known as the horned petal grape, is a climbing vine native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Vitaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish-green berries that are typically consumed by birds and other wildlife. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
